title: What should I name my strong female protagonist? - Quora

response.answer_text: No one comes into the world as a “Strong Female Protagonist©™!” they come in as just another random person. So don’t think of your character as a “Strong Female Protagonist©™!” think of them as you would some other character who’s walking around in the background and name them accordingly. After all, thinking of them as a “Strong Female Protagonist©™!” and giving them a ‘super special, ultra-unique, badass name’ is the first step in scrubbing away all their flaws and turning them into a Mary Sue. Just name them something simple and relatable, something that reminds the readers they’re just as human as everyone else.

The best name for your protagonist should be one that you choose. Look at the setting, the character's personality, their world's history, all these can affect your name choices. Do not be ashamed to choose a simple name. Personally, I have been waiting for the opportunity to name a female character Sam, which although it is simple is a great name for a character. One big thing to consider when using a simple name would be the full version. For example Sam might be Samantha. If you want more ideas for names, my hidden gem is a site called Fantasy Name Generator, which provides all sorts of names for not only humans of all kinds but also other species, magical beasts, pets, places, and much more.
